flourish.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to develop well and be successful
flourish.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The economy is booming and small businesses are flourishing.
flourish.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to grow well and be very healthy
flourish.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Most plants will flourish in the rich deep soils here.
flourish.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to wave something in your hand in order to make people notice it
flourish.translation[0].definitions[2].e: She walked quickly to the desk, flourishing her cheque book.

flourish.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a loud part of a piece of music, played especially when an important person enters
flourish.translation[1].definitions[2].d: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
flourish.translation[2].definitions[0].d: if a business or industry flourishes, it is very successful and makes a profit
